Class ConvertToLetters

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConvertToLetters

  • public class ConvertToLetters
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for converting text to letters. In short it isolates each digit within the inputted number and prints the digits corresponding text based on a series of if-statements.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int cents
      Int that will conatin only the decimals from the users input (ie: when the input is 245.32 "cents = 32")
      private int dollars
      Int that will contain only the whole numbers from the users input (ie: when the input is 245.32 "dollars=245")
      private static java.lang.String hundred
      String containing 100 written as a word
      private static java.lang.String[] ones
      Final and static String array containing all written values between 0-9
      private static java.lang.String[] teens
      Final static String array containing all written values between 0-19
      private static java.lang.String[] tens
      Final static String array containing all written values between 10-90.
      private java.lang.String writtenCheck
      String where the final string value is saved

      ConvertToLetters(double numToChange)
      Constructor for the ConverToLetters class.

      When cents is not 0 it will add "and [cent value]/100" to the final string

    • Field Detail

      • ones

        private static final java.lang.String[] ones
        Final and static String array containing all written values between 0-9

      • teens

        private static final java.lang.String[] teens
        Final static String array containing all written values between 0-19

      • tens

        private static final java.lang.String[] tens
        Final static String array containing all written values between 10-90. The null is to make all values correspond with their 10's place digit

      • hundred

        private static final java.lang.String hundred
        String containing 100 written as a word
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dollars

        private int dollars
        Int that will contain only the whole numbers from the users input (ie: when the input is 245.32 "dollars=245")

      • cents

        private int cents
        Int that will conatin only the decimals from the users input (ie: when the input is 245.32 "cents = 32")

      • writtenCheck

        private java.lang.String writtenCheck
        String where the final string value is saved

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConvertToLetters

        public ConvertToLetters(double numToChange)
        Constructor for the ConverToLetters class. Reads in the user input when called then converts the user input double into two separate ints, dollars and cents, with the use of two static methods getWholeNumber(); and getCents();
        Parameters:
        numToChange - Users input

    • Method Detail

      • convertToWords

        public java.lang.String convertToWords()
        Used to convert the users input into its written form. It is called from the driver class InputClass. The method will call either getOnes(), getTeens(), getTens(), or getHundred() depending on the size of "dollars"
        Returns:
        String writtenCheck containing the final converted string.

      • getDecimalString

        private void getDecimalString()
        When cents is not 0 it will add "and [cent value]/100" to the final string

      • getOnes

        private static java.lang.String getOnes(int onesPlace)
        Static method which returns the one value as a string
        Parameters:
        onesPlace - if dollar amount is less than 10, then input is just the dollar amount. However, when dollars is greater than 10, the input is the derived 1's place.
        Returns:
        String one which contains the written version of the 1's place.

      • getTeens

        private static java.lang.String getTeens(int valueToConvert)
        Static method which returns any "teen" value (10-19)
        Parameters:
        valueToConvert - value from the user input which represent 10-19.
        Returns:
        String teen with "teens" value written as a string.

      • getTens

        private static java.lang.String getTens(int valueToConvert)
        Static method which takes in the 10's place value and converts it to a string. This method also calls the getOnes() method to add the ones place to the string it returns.
        Parameters:
        valueToConvert - 10's place value to convert to string
        Returns:
        String tenString which contains the string version of the inputted int.

      • getHundred

        private static java.lang.String getHundred(int valueToConvert)
        Finds the written 100's place value. It does this by taking the 100's place value and inserting it into the getOnes() method. Then it adds " hundred" to the resulting string.
        Parameters:
        valueToConvert - Hundreds-place value to convert to a string
        Returns:
        String hundred which contains the hundreds-place value converted to a string

      • getWholeNumber

        public static int getWholeNumber(double numToChange)
        Using java's Math.round() method it removes the decimal place from the users Input
        Parameters:
        numToChange - double containing the number to remove the decimal place from
        Returns:
        returns the inputted double as an int without the decimal place

      • getCents

        public static int getCents(double numToChange)
        As with the getWholeNumber() method, this method uses java's Math.round() method to extract the decimal place. However this time it returns just the decimal places rather than the whole number
        Parameters:
        numToChange - double containing the users desired number to isolate the decimal place from
        Returns:
        returns an int containing just the decimal place.
